title: Terri Irwin recalls her cheeky first meeting with late husband Steve
text:
She enjoyed 14 years of marriage to the love of her life, Steve Irwin, before he was tragically killed when a stingray barb pierced his chest in 2006.

And in a new interview with US Weekly, Terri Irwin, 55, recalled what happened the first time she met the Crocodile Hunter back in 1991 while visiting Australia Zoo in Queensland.

The American-born conservationist said that she was 'utterly crushed' when Steve asked her: "Would you like to meet my girlfriend?''

'He asked me if I wanted to meet his girlfriend!' Terri Irwin recalled this week her cheeky first meeting with late husband Steve (pictured together)... as daughter Bindi prepares to marry fiancé Chandler Powell

She said that when they first met, she immediately wanted to ask if he was in a relationship, but didn't know how to say it.

'I think he kind of sensed that, so he said, "would you like to meet my girlfriend?,'' Terri said.

She added: 'I just felt utterly crushed, I was like yeah that'd be really fun. And so he called out "hey, Sue, hey Suey," and here comes this little dog, Suey.'

Daughter Bindi went on to share that her middle name Sue came from the family dog, tying her parents love story perfectly together.

An instant connection: Terri revealed that Steve joked about having a girlfriend and introduced her to his pet dog, Sue

Next to walk down the aisle: Terri's sweet memory comes as her daughter Bindi prepares to marry American wakeboarder Chandler Powell (pictured together), who proposed to her back in July

Bindi also revealed that she and fiancé, Chandler Powell, first encountered each other at the same spot at the zoo where her parents met.

Terri's sweet memory comes as her daughter Bindi prepares to marry the American wakeboarder, who proposed to her back in July.

Bindi took to social media on Sunday to announce she had found her wedding dress.

In her caption she wrote: 'I said yes to the dress,' showing hint of a lace long sleeve design and her stellar 2-carat engagement ring.

Yes to this dress! Bindi took to social media on Sunday to announce that she had found her wedding dress

In the comments fans went on to speculate the dress - rumoured to be a Sareh Nouri A-line frock - was from New York boutique Kleinfeld Bridal - where the show Say Yes To The Dress is filmed.

Last month, Bindi revealed she would be getting married to Chandler at her home in Australia Zoo sometime next year.

'Wedding planning is in full swing for us and it has been an amazing whirlwind,' she revealed in the caption a photo of herself and Chandler posing with a koala.
